title: The Falcon 9 rocket may return to flight as soon as Tuesday night
summary: SpaceX is waiting for a determination from the FAA.

title: Senate appropriators say spending bill includes NASA increase
summary: The leaders of a Senate appropriations subcommittee say they will increase NASA’s budget and protect the Artemis lunar exploration campaign in an upcoming spending bill even as another senator criticized a “wrongheaded” process.

title: Sentinel-2C arrives in French Guiana
summary: The Sentinel-2C satellite, the third Copernicus Sentinel-2 satellite, has arrived at the European spaceport in French Guiana for liftoff on the final Vega rocket in September. Sentinel-2C, like its predecessors, will continue to provide high-quality data for Copernicus – the Earth observation component of the EU Space Programme.

title: LIVE: NASA is with you from Oshkosh
summary: NASA Aeronautics Returns to Oshkosh Sunday, July 21 at 8:30 p.m. EDT NASA will appear at Oshkosh with a full slate of interactive exhibits, informative activities, and fascinating people to meet. But if you can’t make it we’ve got you covered. Enjoy the show virtually right here on this page. John Gould will be onsite […]

title: Curiosity discovers pure sulfur rocks, continues to explore Mount Sharp on Mars
summary: On May 30, NASA’s Curiosity Mars rover, currently exploring Gale Crater on the red planet, drove over a small rock on the Martian surface. The rock cracked open while driving over the rock, revealing its interior composition.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy July 21-27, 2024
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of July 21-27, 2024 and any insight we can offer about them. The House and Senate are in session […]

title: Gaia Prevails Despite a No-Good-Dirty-Rotten Year
summary: The European Space Agency’s Gaia spacecraft continues to collect data despite getting hit by a one-in-a-million meteoroid strike and an electronics-crippling solar storm. Gaia was launched in December 2013 and is now stationed approximately 1.5 million kilometres a year. The spacecraft was tasked with collecting data that would be used to create the most accurate […]

title: South Korea’s new space agency outlines plans
summary: South Korea’s new space agency, less than two months old, is laying out ambitious goals in spaceflight as part of its efforts to serve as a “control tower” for the county’s growing space presence.

title: Nelson: Apollo 11 United the Country in 1969, Artemis Will Too
summary: In marking today’s 55th anniversary of the Apollo 11 landing on the Moon, NASA Administrator Bill Nelson expressed hope that the space program can unite the country again as it […]

title: NASA SLS Core Stage headed to KSC for Artemis II
summary: Prime contractor Boeing rolled out the second Space Launch System (SLS) Core Stage on July 16 from the Michoud Assembly Facility (MAF) and secured it to NASA’s Pegasus barge for transportation to the Kennedy Space Center (KSC) in Florida over the next several days. The stage will control the beginning of the Artemis II mission that will send a four-person crew on an Orion spacecraft on a lunar flyby; the question now is when that mission will happen.
